modules.description: Provides functions to create and manage a terminal session, including refreshing the display, rendering images, adjusting the cursor position, and retrieving terminal size. Operates on terminal handles and asynchronous I/O channels. Used to build interactive terminal applications that respond to user input and screen resizing.

Provides asynchronous I/O operations for handling non-blocking reads and writes on file descriptors, with support for event-driven communication. Works with file descriptors, buffers, and asynchronous callbacks to manage I/O events efficiently. Used to implement network protocols and real-time data processing in concurrent applications.

Manages terminal sessions with asynchronous I/O, enabling dynamic display updates, image rendering, and cursor control. Operates on terminal handles and supports resizing events. Allows for real-time user interaction and screen adjustments. Examples include building responsive dashboards or text-based games that update dynamically.
